theories.name: Communities of Practice (Wenger)
theories.rationale: The current model captures movement from periphery to core but lacks key CoP concepts like legitimate peripheral participation, boundary objects, and shared repertoire. Adding these elements will better represent how newcomers become legitimate participants and how community practices evolve through participation and reification.

variables.name: Legitimate Peripheral Participation
variables.description: Effectiveness of newcomers engaging in meaningful but low-risk community activities

variables.name: Community Shared Repertoire
variables.description: Accumulated shared resources, routines, artifacts, and vocabulary of the community

variables.name: Boundary Objects Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of artifacts that enable coordination between different participant groups

variables.name: Mutual Engagement Building
variables.description: Rate at which community members develop shared practices through interaction

variables.name: Reification Process
variables.description: Rate at which community practices become formalized into artifacts and documentation

theories.name: Nonaka's SECI Model
theories.rationale: The current model has knowledge conversion flows but lacks explicit representation of the four SECI modes and their enabling conditions. Adding socialization, externalization, combination, and internalization as distinct processes with their own enablers will create a more accurate representation of the knowledge creation spiral.

variables.name: Socialization Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of tacit-to-tacit knowledge transfer through shared experiences

variables.name: Externalization Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of converting tacit knowledge to explicit knowledge

variables.name: Combination Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of combining and systemizing explicit knowledge

variables.name: Internalization Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of converting explicit knowledge back to tacit knowledge

variables.name: Ba (Shared Context)
variables.description: Shared physical, virtual, or mental space that enables knowledge creation
Rate at which implicit knowledge is converted to explicit knowledge (Externalization)
Rate at which explicit knowledge is converted to implicit knowledge (Internalization)
